title: Relative Semantics Are More Real Than Absolute Semantics
author: Not specified in the provided text.
date_published: Not specified in the provided text.
dek: Subjective experiences and social interactions shape our understanding of the world more than objective measurements.  The author argues that "relative semantics," focusing on relational comparisons and shared experiences, are more meaningful and prevalent than "absolute semantics," which rely on objective, quantifiable data, particularly within social contexts.
